body_html: @zheng-xq Yes, I'm on Ubuntu 15.10 and I was using GCC 5.2.1. The issue was the compiler. I couldn't figure out how to change the compiler with bazel but simply installing gcc-4.8 and using update-alternatives to change the symlinks in usr/bin seems to have worked. (More info: http://askubuntu.com/questions/26498/choose-gcc-and-g-version). Thanks for the help, I'll report back if I experience any further issues.

body: @zheng-xq Yes, I'm on Ubuntu 15.10 and I was using GCC 5.2.1. The issue was the compiler. I couldn't figure out how to change the compiler with bazel but simply installing gcc-4.8 and using update-alternatives to change the symlinks in usr/bin seems to have worked. (More info: http://askubuntu.com/questions/26498/choose-gcc-and-g-version). Thanks for the help, I'll report back if I experience any further issues.
